marketplaces.name: WSDOT Ferry
marketplaces.description: Claude Code plugin for Washington State Ferry information
marketplaces.repo_description: CLI tool for WSDOT ferry schedules, vessel tracking, and space availability

files.README.md:
# wsdot-ferry-cli

Command-line tool for Washington State Ferries. Look up schedules, track vessels, and check space availability from your terminal.

## Requirements

- Python 3.10+
- [WSDOT API key](https://wsdot.wa.gov/traffic/api/)

## Installation

```bash
pipx install git+https://github.com/rhb/wsdot-ferry-cli.git
```

Or with pip:

```bash
pip install git+https://github.com/rhb/wsdot-ferry-cli.git
```

## Configuration

Get a free API key at https://wsdot.wa.gov/traffic/api/ and set it as an environment variable:

```bash
export WSDOT_API_KEY="your-api-key"
```

Add this to your `~/.zshrc` or `~/.bashrc` to persist it.

## Claude Code Skill

This repo includes a Claude Code skill that lets you ask ferry questions in natural language (e.g. "is there space on the next ferry to Lopez?").

### Install the plugin

```bash
/plugin marketplace add rhb/wsdot-ferry-cli
/plugin install wsdot-ferry
```

Requires the `wsdot` CLI and `WSDOT_API_KEY` to be set up first (see above).

## Usage

### Schedule

Show the ferry schedule between two terminals:

```bash
wsdot schedule seattle bainbridge
wsdot schedule edmonds kingston --date tomorrow
wsdot schedule anacortes "friday harbor" --date saturday
```

Options:
- `--date`, `-d` — Date to query (`YYYY-MM-DD`, `today`, `tomorrow`, or a weekday name). Defaults to today.
- `--route`, `-r` — Route ID for full route schedule.

### Vessels

Show vessel locations (San Juan Islands):

```bash
wsdot vessels
wsdot vessels --vessel samish
```

Options:
- `--vessel`, `-v` — Filter to a specific vessel by name.

### Space availability

Show drive-up and reservable space for upcoming sailings:

```bash
wsdot space anacortes lopez
wsdot space seattle bainbridge
```

### Terminals

List all ferry terminals:

```bash
wsdot terminals
```

### Routes

List known WSF routes:

```bash
wsdot routes
```

## Supported terminals

Terminal names are case-insensitive. Terminals with spaces can be quoted or hyphenated.

| Name | Aliases |
|------|---------|
| Anacortes | `anacortes` |
| Bainbridge Island | `bainbridge` |
| Bremerton | `bremerton` |
| Clinton | `clinton` |
| Coupeville | `coupeville` |
| Edmonds | `edmonds` |
| Fauntleroy | `fauntleroy` |
| Friday Harbor | `friday-harbor`, `friday harbor`, `fridayharbor` |
| Kingston | `kingston` |
| Lopez Island | `lopez` |
| Mukilteo | `mukilteo` |
| Orcas Island | `orcas` |
| Point Defiance | `point defiance` |
| Port Townsend | `port townsend` |
| Seattle | `seattle` |
| Shaw Island | `shaw` |
| Southworth | `southworth` |
| Tahlequah | `tahlequah` |
| Vashon Island | `vashon` |

## Date formats

The `--date` flag accepts:

- `today` — today's date (default)
- `tomorrow` — tomorrow's date
- A weekday name — next occurrence of that day (e.g., `friday`, `saturday`)
- ISO format — `YYYY-MM-DD` (e.g., `2025-07-04`)

## Development

Install with dev dependencies:

```bash
pip install -e ".[dev]"
```

Run tests:

```bash
pytest
```
